programme.title: Rugrats in Paris
programme.desc: Animated adventure. The second feature outing for the Rugrats takes them to Paris, where Chuckie's widowed father has been called on to mend an animated monster in a theme park.

programme.title: The House of Magic
programme.desc: Family animated adventure. A cruelly abandoned ginger kitten is rescued by a kindly elderly magician who lives in a creepy mansion. But the kitten's troubles aren't over yet.

programme.title: Cocoon
programme.desc: Heart-warming sci-fi comedy. A group of retirees are rejuvenated after swimming in a pool storing strange objects from the sea. With Steve Guttenberg and Oscar-winning Don Ameche.
Comedy with Kenneth Williams, Bernard Cribbins, Charles Hawtrey and Barbara Windsor. An undercover agent and his bumbling trainees are sent to track down a stolen top-secret formula.
programme.title: Carry On Spying
The Hunger Games: Mockingjay...
programme.desc: ...Part 2: (2015) The final part of the dark dystopian fantasy-adventure starring Jennifer Laurence. The rebels prepare to battle for freedom and the future of their country. Violence.

programme.title: Assassin's Creed
programme.desc: Sci-fi action-thriller with Michael Fassbender. A modern-day American is transported back to 15th-century Spain to help the Knights Templar find a mythical source of power. Violence.
Outrageous comedy. A man struggles to accept his daughter's boorish boyfriend is about to pop the question. With Bryan Cranston, James Franco and Megan Mullally. Strong language.
programme.title: Why Him?

programme.desc: Thriller with Isabelle Huppert. A woman's distrust of the police takes her on an unconventional path to justice when she is raped. In French/subs. Sexual violence/strong language.
programme.title: Elle
